intro: Dianthus koreanus, commonly known as the Korean carnation, is a flowering plant native to Korea. It belongs to the Caryophyllaceae family and is characterized by its showy, clustered flowers in shades of pink, red, and white. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm and features hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Dianthus koreanus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and as a cut flower.
